name: individualconsentidentifier
label: Individual consent identifier
description: A data item consisting of a unique identification code designating an informed consent.

name: aboutsubject
label: About subject
description: The person (subject) whom this individual consent applies.

name: consentformused
label: Consent form used
description: The informed consent form that was signed.

name: consentformversion
label: Consent form version
description: A related resource that is a version, edition, or adaptation of the described resource. Used when a patient requests adaptation or partial withdrawal of the consent.

name: collectedby
label: Collected by
description: Indicates the person, group, or institution who performed the collection act.

name: signingdate
label: Signing date
description: A date specification that designates when an informed consent form was signed.

name: validfrom
label: Valid from
description: Date (often a range) of validity of a resource.

name: validuntil
label: Valid until
description: Date (often a range) of validity of a resource.

name: representedby
label: Represented by
description: An individual who is authorized under applicable State or local law to consent on behalf of a child or incapable person to general medical care including participation in clinical research.

name: allowresearch
label: Allow research
description: Barring any restrictions, allow research investigations that requires an informed consent process to take place that make use of material or data from the patient.

name: restrictedto
label: Restricted to
description: E.g. a dataset is restricted to an instance of an investigation for a specific disease or at geographical location.

name: allowlinkage
label: Allow linkage
description: A study in which data from different sources are "linked". Usually used to compile epidemiological data. The logic of record linkage is that two or more items of information about a person recorded at different times, and perhaps in different places, may be of greater value when considered together than when either is considered alone.

name: allowreidentification
label: Allow reidentification
description: The procedure of having an identity established. Implicitly, this answers the question whether a patient would like to be recontacted for e.g. an answer to their diagnostic question.

name: allowincidentalfindings
label: Allow incidental findings
description: A planned process for a subject agrees not to be informed about any incidental finding.

name: recontactmethod
label: Recontact method
description: A document part that prescribes a method of contact in the future.
